section.title: Access to the Source Code
section.para: Draco is currently under CVS configuration management. The repository is on the CCS-4 network. In the near future we plan on moving the repository to the SourceForge server at LANL. To gain access to the source code you will need a computer account on the CCS-4 LAN and you must be made a member of the radtran Unix file sharing group. You may need to work with your line manager and/or the CCS system administrators to gain access to these computer systems.
Draco can be checked out from the repository by:

listitem.para: Setting the environment variable \c CVS_RSH to \c ssh;
Issuing the following checkout command:> cvs -d sixhitch::codes/radtran/cvsroot co -P draco

section.para: If your workstation mounts /codes/radtran you do not need to include sixhitch: as a part of the path. Optionally, you can set the environment variable CVSROOT to the the string shown in the example above. In this case, you can omit the argument flag and value that specifies the repository location.
